column4: I have just mounted /dev/hda1 to /media/hda1 and /dev/hdb1 to /media/hdb1, how can i get them to appear in the Computer Section/On my desktop?
you could create a link to the directory for the mount locations, but unmounting won't remove the links..
i had mount-on-boot problems, i have now fixed them, but have yet to reboot, would a reboot with a fixed fstab file show them in the computer section?
fstab works in real time, so I doubt it
if i pastebin-ed my fstab file, could you please check it?
if you've edited your fstab just umount then mount them again, that'd proberly fix it
oh, and yeah, pastebin it and I'll take a look.

i tried that, i got a error on umount: "/dev busy, /var/run busy & / busy" on mount -a i hear the harddrive thinking, but nothing happens, i get a print of the output as such: http://recoding.pastebin.org/12569

what I meant by umount was to just umount your two partitions that were causing the trouble: "umount /dev/hda1 /dev/hdb1" -- "umount -a" unmounts everything it can, which is the reason for your error.
still no luck :( here is a pastebin of my fstab and the fdisk -l, http://recoding.pastebin.org/12571
why don't you have anything set to mount to / ?
i had a number of problems with it when i installed ubuntu, this is the best copy of the file i could find, if it is incomplete i am not suprised, could you please help me to fix it?
for the moment run "mount" without any arguments to find out what is mounted where, pastebin it if you need help
this? /dev/hdb2 on / type ext3 (rw,errors=remount-ro)
plan b, i'll pastebin
right, so you should edit fstab to set /dev/hdb2 to /, boot will fail without that :P
thanks for saving my life :P
this is a pastebin of the mount output, and the modified fstab, please check, thankyou for your help :) http://recoding.pastebin.org/12573
you have /dev/hdb2 mounted twice...
my computer is funny like that..or is it the operator.. :( i hate it when i break things

first thing I'd do would be to reorder fstab to put /dev/hdb2 at the top, that way your sure it mounts first. then I'd proberly restart to get rid of your double, should also make the disk options appear on your desktop.
okay, i can do the first bit, but how do i enable disc options on desktop? [new to this stuff]
should work automaticly(did for me)
Okay, rebooting, thankyou for your help!
